result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Letter to Court date 10/18 from ADA Molly Schmidt re: State's intent to dismiss 22CF1122.

**Reviewed by Judge Bohren on October 18, 2022.**
Trial Order signed by Judge Michael O. Bohren on 10/18/22

10:35 AM Defendant Darryl D Mire in court, in custody.  Attorney Pablo Galaviz in court for Darryl D Mire.  Attorney Molly M Schmidt in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case called to address State's motion to disimiss 22CF1122.
Court notes Defense filed a motion to dismiss as well.
State gives background on the motion.
Court notes the transcript of the preliminary hearing in 22CF1122 has not been filed with the court as ordered at the last hearing.
Court orders the transcript must still be filed with the Court.
Arguments by the Defense.
Arguments by the State.
Court denies the Defense's motion to dismiss 22CF1122 based on the speedy trial statute.
Court denies the Defense's motion to dismiss 22CF1122 and 22CF1493 based on double jeopardy.
Court denies the State's motion to set 22CF1493 for trial on 11/29/22 and dismiss 22CF1122.
Court will use the 10/24/22 hearing to address the Defense's objection to the Amended Complaint as there is no motion for joinder from the State.
State is not pursuing the Amended Complaint in 22CF1122.
Court orders 22CF1122 will proceed on  the charges in the original Information, Counts 1-7.
Court cancels the hearing set for 11/24/22.
22CF1122 remains set for jury status hearing on 11/21/22 with the jury trial commencing on 11/29/22.
Defense has entered a speedy trial demand in 22CF1493.
Defense notes the transcript from 9/23/22 has been ordered and expects to file a motion to attack the arraignment in 22CF1493.
Parties agree that the 90 day deadline in 22CF1493 commences with the date of the preliminary hearing on 10/12/22.
Parties agree that the deadline for starting the jury trial in 22CF1493 is 1/20/23.
Jury trial in 22CF1493 expected to last 5 days.  Court will select 2 alternate jurors.  Each side will be entitled to 5 strikes.  Clerk to prepare a trial order.
Motion To Dismiss All The Charges With Prejudice
Order to Withdraw as Counsel, signed by Judge Michael O. Bohren on October 6, 2022
Proposed Order to Withdraw as Counsel as to Atty. Gutierrez and Atty. Miller filed by Atty. Gutierrez

8:49 AM Defendant Darryl D Mire in court, in custody.  Attorney Pablo Galaviz in court for Darryl D Mire.  Attorney Molly M Schmidt in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Galaviz requests 22CF1493 be rescheduled for jury trial according to the speedy trial demand.
Attorney Galaviz would like to enter a speedy trial demand on 22CF1493.
State notes the preliminary hearing in 22CF1493 is set for Friday and the demand can be filed then.
State intends to file a motion for joinder following that preliminary hearing.
Court incorporates the findings from 9/23/22 into this hearing to schedule the jury trial dates.
Jury trial expected to last 4 days.  Court will select 2 alternate jurors.  Each side will be entitled to 5 strikes.  Clerk to prepare an amended trial order.
State filed an amended complaint in 22CF1122.  
Defense acknowledges receipt but objects.
Arguments by the State.
State also filed an amended information in 22CF1122.
Defense would like time to review the preliminary hearing transcript.
Court accepts the amended complaint and amended information while preserving the right for the defendant to challenge them.
State to order the preliminary hearing transcript in 22CF1122.
Court orders the transcript to be filed by 10/14/22.
Court will set a hearing to address the amended complaint and amended information.
Court will address a motion for joinder, if any is filed, at that same date.
Hearing scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Jury status hearing scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on November 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing on November 21, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Hearing on October 24, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Atty. Pablo Galaviz
Atty. Pablo Galaviz
**Electronically declined by Judge Michael O. Bohren on September 30, 2022 - Submit Order in proper form.**
Proposed Order to Withdraw as Counsel

2:41 PM Defendant Darryl D Mire in court, in custody.  Attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez in court for Darryl D Mire.  Attorney Cassandra A Miller Ms. in court for Darryl D Mire.  Prosecuting attorney Molly M Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case called for jury status hearing on 22CF1122.
Court addresses motion for continuance filed by the State and the motion by the defense counsel to withdraw.
Statements by the State.
Statements by Attorney Miller.
Statements by Attorney Gutierrez.
Defendant maintains his speedy trial demand.
Statements by defendant.
Court grants the motion for continuance.
Court grants the motion for Attorney Gutierrez and Attorney Miller to withdraw.
Court will remove the jury trial and schedule a status hearing.
Statements by the State.
Court extends findings that the trial can not go forward within the 90 day limit and finds good cause to adjourn.
Court conducts initial appearance in 22CF1493.
Hearing scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Hearing on October 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Trial Order signed by Judge Michael O. Bohren July 27, 2022.

Jury status hearing on September 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on September 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Proposed Trial order.

11:12 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Darryl D Mire in court, in custody at WCJ, with attorney Cassandra A Miller.   Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court notes a Speedy Trial Demand has been filed, noting the trial must be heard by 9/16/22.   Atty. Gutierrez believes the trial must be heard by 10/18/22 and notes a trial date has been set with counsel and the clerk before the matter was called on the record.  Court confirms the trial would need to be heard by 10/18/2022.  Court confirms the jury status and trial dates with counsel. Court will prepare and sign a pretrial order.  Court adjourns for jury status and jury trial.  Jury status hearing scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on July 27, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Service of Protective Order, filed by Waukesha County Sheriff

08:40 AM Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Darryl D Mire in court, in custody, with attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez.   

Defense prepared to proceed to a preliminary hearing.
City of Waukesha Detective Shelly Fischer sworn in and testified on direct by Attorney Schmidt.
Cross examination by Attorney Gutierrez. 
State rests.
Attorney Schmidt presents closing arguments and moves for bind over.
Attorney Schmidt further states they will be adding a Count 7 of felony stalking to the information today.
Attorney Gutierrez presents closing arguments and objects to bind over and further objects to an additional count of stalking being added to the information today.
Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.  
Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  
Bail remains as fixed.
Attorney Gutierrez submits a request for a speedy trial on the record.
Court sets a date for further proceedings as soon as possible before the Trial Court.  Hearing scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 10:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Darryl D Mire
Current: 515 W Moreland Blvd, c/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 07-12-2022)
Prior: 10913 W Hampton Ave,8, Milwaukee, WI 53218

If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with Victim A/Victim B/Witness A/Witness B/Witness C listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant to comply with GPS monitoring through Wisconsin Community Services.  Defendant is not to come within 2 miles of Victim A/Victim B/Witness A/Witness B/Witness C listed in the Victim Identification Key, or their residence, employment, school or anywhere they frequent.  Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release.  Defendant not to leave the State of Wisconsin without prior authorization from the Court.  Defendant to surrender their passport to the Waukesha Criminal Traffic Office (Room C226) within 24 hours of release from custody.  Defendant is not permitted to apply for the issuance, duplicate nor renewal of a passport and/or passport card during the pendency of this action.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms/knives.  Court orders a protective order pursuant to 940.47 for Victim A/Victim B/Witness A/Witness B/Witness C listed in the Victim Identification Key.  Court further orders the protective order to be sealed.

02:04 PM Defendant Darryl D Mire in court, in custody with State Public Defender Intern Mark Maier.   Kristi Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 10 DAYS.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 09:15 am.  Status conference scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
